title: [Large-Scale] Mobile Microlearning Courses for Expanding Work-Integrated Learning (WIL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Career Exploration and Social Advancement
context.additional_context: Students learn WIL theory and practical case applications in mobile environments, conducting small-scale projects linked to community partnerships

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core concepts and educational effects of WIL
Learners design and execute WIL-based problem-solving projects using mobile platforms

Learners collaborate with one local community center or social enterprise to design a WIL project, perform a three-stage simulation (planning-execution-evaluation), and submit a 5-page final report incorporating peer evaluations (≥3 peers) and instructor feedback (≥2 sessions) within three days after course completion.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
